location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Nicholas Hankey Smith, Resident at Bushire to John Elphinston, Accountant General, Bombay

physicalDescription.extent: Condition: The item has suffered from pest damage, resulting in a couple of large holes. These holes obscure a significant amount of text on the verso side of the folio, as well as the address of the letter. This means that this text is difficult to read, however it is still possible to make out the intended recipient.

mods.abstract: The letter is an acknowledgement of the receipt of orders dated 2 May 1807 and a response to queries regarding the Residency's accounts and use of funds.
